name: Kristin RICHMOND, Appellee v. PRUDENTIAL PROPERTY AND CASUALTY INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Richmond v. Prudential Property & Casualty Insurance

judges: Before CAPPY, C.J., and CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN, SAYLOR, EAKIN and LAMB, JJ.
parties: Kristin RICHMOND, Appellee v. PRUDENTIAL PROPERTY AND CASUALTY INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellant.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Remanded to Superior Court for consideration in light of Prudential v. Colbert, 813 A.2d 747 (Pa.2002). Jurisdiction relinquished.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Charles W. Craven, Philadelphia, for Prudential Property and Cas. Ins. Co., Appellant.
David Gerald Knerr, Michael J. Piosa, Allentown, for Kristin Richmond, Appellee.
Matthew Stephen Crosby, Scott B. Cooper, Harrisburg, for PA Trial Lawyers Ass’n, Appellee Amicus Curiae.
casebody.head_matter:
821 A.2d 1246
Kristin RICHMOND, Appellee v. PRUDENTIAL PROPERTY AND CASUALTY INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued April 7, 2003.
Decided April 25, 2003.
Charles W. Craven, Philadelphia, for Prudential Property and Cas. Ins. Co., Appellant.
David Gerald Knerr, Michael J. Piosa, Allentown, for Kristin Richmond, Appellee.
Matthew Stephen Crosby, Scott B. Cooper, Harrisburg, for PA Trial Lawyers Ass’n, Appellee Amicus Curiae.
Before CAPPY, C.J., and CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN, SAYLOR, EAKIN and LAMB, JJ.
